column5: Gave her another go yesterday...  pulled my line in and rebaited, cast out, was in the process of setting my baitrunner/alarm when line starts peeling out...  found this fellow on the other end    Paul/Fang went 1 for 3  Mine was caught using his top secret bait  another gorup of 4 went 2 for 2  We brought the camp stove, Andrea/Whitefox/love of my life  made Hamburgers and studied for her RN exam.  Definitely a Great Day
Thats not the six mile lake report I was looking forward to??????????  GEZZZZZZZZZ thats ugly....................The fish.HEHE

Way to go Goran  Reminds me to send you that secret recipe. I'll have to hit the bulk barn to remind myself what the heck went into that mess.  I should have stayed for a burger but you know I had strict instructions when to be home.  Stopped by Fish on line today and picked up a couple extra flavours of boilies  Maybe hit that spot 1 more time next weekend before changing over to chase salmon out on the big lake.

Got up there Saturday, set up camp and ate...  after that went out on a paddle boat, note to self, Fat Man does not go in Paddle Boat... returned that and got a canoe, did some canoeing and then a little bit of fishing. couple of sunfish... not picture worthy...  went back for dinner, ate then the rain started...  woke up the next morning, to a grey sky, went for a hike thought about renting a boat, but Andrea was cold and didn't feel like sitting in an open boat the rest of the day, so we decided to pack it in and head home... weather wasn't looking too good anyways. left the park around 4, stopped by bass pro on the way home...  Sorry to Dissappoint Brian, Info greatly appreciated though!!
Nice carp, any idea of the wieght on that fish?
Nice fish. I'm new to carping. Whats the secret bait   dsn

nice fish!  that happened to me last week too ... line started peeling out the moment i clicked the baitrunner switch ... at first i thought that line's going out because the drag was too loose ... lols ... i was so clueless
Great pic and report!!!... that looks like a very strong fish!
Great report there UncleBuck.Looks like you had the perfect day for it.
That's wonderful   .  And you got that great smell on your shirt all the way home to remind you what a great day it was.

Great job and nice fish!!! Same thing happened to me the other week...cast out my line and began the waiting game...you know...hours and hours of waiting.  I dont have bite alarms....my alarm is my finger around the line near the spool.  I cast out, reached down for my coffee and my rod almost flies out of my hands...LOL.  They sure are fun to bring in....nice going!
